beak.utilities.preparation module

beak.utilities.preparation.create_encodings_from_dataframe(value_columns: List[str], data: DataFrame, export_absent: bool) → Tuple[DataFrame, List[str]][source]

Create encodings for categorical data.

Parameters:

  • value_columns (List[str]) – List of column names containing categorical values.

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – Input data frame.

  • export_absent (bool) – Flag indicating whether to export “Absent” columns.

Returns:

Encoded data frame. List[str]: List of new column names.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

beak.utilities.preparation.impute_data(data: ndarray | DataFrame | GeoDataFrame, columns: List[str] | None = None, strategy: str = 'mean', fill_value: Number | str | None = None, missing_values: Number | None = nan) → ndarray | DataFrame | GeoDataFrame[source]

Imputes missing values in the given data using the specified strategy.

For arrays, the data needs to be in the shape (rows, columns), e.g. 3 layers with 5 entries each: (5, 3).

Parameters:

  • data (Union[np.ndarray, pd.DataFrame, gpd.GeoDataFrame]) – The data to be imputed.

  • columns (List[str]) – The columns to be imputed.

  • strategy (str, optional) – The imputation strategy. Defaults to “mean”.

  • fill_value (Union[Number, str], optional) – The value to fill missing values with. Defaults to None.

  • missing_values (Optional[Number], optional) – The value to be treated as missing. Defaults to np.nan.

Returns:

The imputed data.

Return type:

Union[np.ndarray, pd.DataFrame, gpd.GeoDataFrame]

beak.utilities.preparation.create_nan_buffer(array: ndarray, target_value: Number = 1, radius: int = 1) → ndarray[source]

Creates a buffer of NaN values around the selected value in a given array.

Parameters:

  • array (np.ndarray) – The array to be buffered.

  • target_value (Number) – The value to be buffered. Defaults to 1.

  • radius (int) – Number of cells (distance) to the targeted value to be changed. Defaults to 1. E.g. radius of 1 will change the 8 cells around the targeted value.

Returns:

The buffered array.

Return type:

np.ndarray

beak.utilities.preparation.delete_nan_elements(array: ndarray, transpose: bool = True) → ndarray[source]
